item.description:
Hi all,
When is an event not an event? Hmm.... When we don't go to a restaurant to discuss afterward!

Into Great Silence

Into Great Silence is only playing one night at The Brattle and is nearly 3 hours long, getting us to the restaurant at 9:30 which is too late on a weeknite for any long discussion.

This is a film the group saw last Spring and it is still mentioned often in conversations at other events. Everyone who saw it was strongly impressed. ( I missed it due to an emergency). Brattle has chosen it as part of their Recent Raves selections- great movies that you might have missed.

4 Stars! One of the transporting film experiences of this or any other year. Ty Burr, The Boston Globe

Enthralling is not necessarily the word you would expect to use to describe a documentary about an enclave of nearly silent monks but German filmmaker Gr√∂ning makes his film just that. This beautifully filmed, award-winning film is an examination of life inside the headquarters of the reclusive Carthusian Order of French monks, a 17th-century monastery high in the Alps outside Grenoble, France. Brattle Description

The rhythm of work, prayer and reflection,the attitude described as "joyful penitence" flows in a cycle that feels not so much ancient as timeless. The film's achievement is to capture, within a brief, elliptical span, this slow, delicate rhythm. NY Times

Here is a link to a complete review: http://www.washington...

So, we'll meet as usual near the front row when the film is over and talk about it for a bit, who knows- maybe get a cup of decaf somewhere. I'm trying hard to resist saying we may just give each other a nod of assent... darn, I said it.

Tom
item.how_to_find_us: As is our custom, Tom will be standing near the front row at the movie's conclusion.
